name: Residual pool connectivity
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Extent to which water remains in contact with both banks and low benches during low flow, sustaining edge habitat and exchange.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count pools that remain connected versus isolated at low flow and note dominant disconnection causes.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Pools remain connected at low flow, or dryness is normal and not beyond reference.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Some partial isolation but at least half of pools still have a flow path.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Most pools are isolated and surface flow is minimal.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Complete isolation or stagnant pools across most of the reach.
